info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 10 at 3:36AM AKST until November 11 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau AK
info.description:
...INCOMING LOW BRINGING PROLONGED SNOWFALL TO THE KLONDIKE HIGHWAY...
.A low pressure continues to work northward into the Gulf of Alaska this morning. Updated forecast guidance continues to show a track farther to the east bringing more moisture into the panhandle allowing for a greater potential for snow with the southwesterly winds near ridgetop.
* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 7 to 12 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph.
* WHERE...Klondike Highway.
* WHEN...From noon today to noon AKST Tuesday.
* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult and is discouraged.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates are expected to increase later this morning as the next front moves closer to the panhandle. The heaviest rates are expected late this evening through the overnight hours into tomorrow before snowfall rates slow midday tomorrow.
info.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.
People are urged to prepare their property before the onset of winter weather.
For the latest road conditions, where available, call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.

parameter.value: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO NOON AKST TUESDAY
